serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Highways is a polyline theme representing the major and minor highways of the United States. These include interstates, U.S. highways, state highways, major roads, and minor roads. This dataset is a subset of the Streets dataset. It contains all Class 1, 2, and 3 road segments plus any other roads segments necessary to provide network connectivity for the Class_Rte field. Attribute information includes the highway type, class, direction and name.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Highways provides a subset of highways and roads from the Streets dataset for national, state, and regional display.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:100,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.0.0.532

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar:
The geospatial part of this data set was extracted from the 2000 Census TIGER/Line files. The positional accuracy varies with the source materials used, but generally the information is no better than the established national map Accuracy standards for 1:100,000-scale maps from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). To improve the accuracy, Tele Atlas ran a process against the entire nationwide database.
The level of positional accuracy in the StreetMap files is not suitable for high-precision measurement applications such as engineering problems, property transfers, or other uses that might require highly accurate measurements of the earth's surface.

citeinfo.title: Tele Atlas TIGER/Line 2000 Streets, 2008
citeinfo.othercit: TIGER/Line 2000 Data Processed by a proprietary line straightening process by Tele Atlas North America, Inc.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI: From StreetMap Detailed Streets, extracted all Class 1, 2, and 3 road segments plus any other road segments necessary to provide network connectivity for the CLASS_RTE attribute. Converted the data set to SDC. Created the projection file (.prj) and spatial indices.

enttyp.enttypd: The lines represent the major and minor highways of the United States. These include Interstates, U.S. Highways, State Highways, major roads, and minor roads.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Prefix directions of the address attributes for the features.
Prefix highway types of the address attributes for the features.
Suffix highway types of the address attributes for the features.
Suffix directions of the address attributes for the features.

attr.attrdef: The highway class (used for routing and connectivity).

edom.edomvd: A special class of highway to do very fast high level cross-country routing that also selects the through-route in complicated urban areas.
